etymology.description: pictogram (象形): a pig; compare 亥, 𢑓 ‘male pig’, and 豖 ‘castrated male pig’.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a pig in profile with head, body, and legs. Related forms differentiate types of pigs; in 㒸, the pig element serves as a phonetic.

examples.chinese: 古书中常以“豕”指代猪(古書中常以「豕」指代豬)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔshū zhōng cháng yǐ “shǐ” zhǐdài zhū.
examples.english: In ancient texts, “豕” refers to a pig.

examples.chinese: 在甲骨文里，豕的形状清晰可见(在甲骨文裡，豕的形狀清晰可見)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jiǎgǔwén lǐ, shǐ de xíngzhuàng qīngxī kějiàn.
examples.english: In oracle bone inscriptions, the form of 豕 is clearly visible.

examples.chinese: 成语“豕突狼奔”中的“豕”意为猪(成語「豕突狼奔」中的「豕」意為豬)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngyǔ “shǐ tū láng bēn” zhōng de “shǐ” yìwéi zhū.
examples.english: In the idiom “豕突狼奔,” “豕” means pig.
